thrust::negate

thrust::negate< T > Struct Template Reference

#include <functional.h>

Public Member Functions

__host__ __device__ T operator() (const T &x) const

Detailed Description

template<typename T>
struct thrust::negate< T >

negate is a function object. Specifically, it is an Adaptable Unary Function. If f is an object of class negate<T>, and x is an object of class T, then f(x,y) returns -x.

Template Parameters:
T is a model of Assignable, and if x is an object of type T, then -x must be defined and must have a return type that is convertible to T.
The following code snippet demonstrates how to use negate to negate the element of a device_vector of floats.

  #include <thrust/device_vector.h>
  #include <thrust/functional.h>
  #include <thrust/range.h>
  #include <thrust/transform.h>
  ...
  const int N = 1000;
  thrust::device_vector<float> V1(N);
  thrust::device_vector<float> V2(N);

  thrust::range(V1.begin(), V1.end(), 1);

  thrust::transform(V1.begin(), V1.end(), V2.begin(),
                     thrust::negate<float>());
  // V2 is now {-1, -2, -3, ..., -1000}

See also:
http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/negate.html

unary_function

Function call operator. The return value is -x.
